text: no one person is responsible for this
crisis but if there's a single person
you might want to put in stocks and have
people throw rotten apples that it would
be Alan Greenspan mostly because he more
than anyone could have done something to
at least diminish the scale of this
thing there was as this housing bubble
was building it was it was the clearest
bubble I've ever seen economically but
he insisted that there was none he was
warned specifically about subprime
lending by members of the of the Board
of Governors and he refused to do
anything about it he stood against any
kind of regulation he he assured people
that financial derivatives had made the
system much more secure and all of these
ways he helped to block there was
nothing nothing precautionary was going
to be done as long as Alan Greenspan was
both assuring everybody that things were
fine and to the extent that it was
actually his authority refusing to take
any any action and so I suspect that no
matter who was there we would have had
something like this it was probably
going to be a a crisis but it wouldn't
have been as big and wouldn't have been
as devastating without Greenspan
you
